I'm not sure if I'd call myself a supporter, but I also like Dortmund because I really like the chemistry and positivity between players, fans, and the management. The town that I live in has a military base, and a lot of the kids that come here have lived in Germany in the past, so naturally they just pick up liking Bayern, so there is a decent amount of Bayern fans in my school, and I felt like Dortmund didn't get as much love. Also Christian Pulisic.
I think the vast majority of democrats can at least respect this appointment. The only problem that I personally have with him is that he is so clearly pro-Israel
Ah ok I see now, the way Cleveland labeled on the map makes it seem like it's in the 9th, zoomed in closer and found the dot.

Districts are supposed to be relatively equal in population, but surely the 9th district (which includes Cleveland AND Toledo) doesn't have close to the population of the 3rd district (Columbus) right?

The majority of Trump's cabinet picks have not been good, however Betsy DeVos is so incredibly unqualified and just plain stupid. Even if the Republicans want to get rid of the Department of Education, it is still a job that needs to be done until it's termination. This is ridiculous.

I feel like Pettine is probably the best option but it feels like so long ago since we interviewed him. There must have been something wrong with his approach to the team. Same with Bradley. I think the most realistic outcome is that we will end up promoting Manusky, as much as I'd rather not.
So who will we promote then, because I was under the impression he was the next man up. Or will it be an outside hire?
Same here. I feel embarrassed to say that but as an American, the interest level isn't insanely high here, and it's not like I could experience a game atmosphere either.
He's only 32, I highly doubt he'd call it quits. Once he leaves us he'll move to a mid table club in Spain and play for a while.

Eh, I'll take a hard pass on that one.
It frustrates me that some people believe the only way to be morally and ethically sound is through religion.

Companies should be free to manufacture their products wherever they wish and with this they are punished because they want to put their plant in Mexico. It's an obstruction of capitalism in my opinion as well, and capitalism is something a lot of Trump supporters and Trump himself find pride in.
To extend it even further, Trump wants to stop illegal immigration. Many immigrants who come illegally come because they want to find jobs. Taking jobs away from Mexico will not make Mexicans stay in Mexico, more will come to America in search of jobs.
This tariff proposal is ridiculously unfair.

I'm with you in regards to sticking with Kirk, but the idea is that we would draft a QB with the second overall. Either Trubisky or Watson I'd imagine. We would be saving cap room by not paying them as much and we'd be able to pump more money into the defense, but I don't think it's worth losing a franchise QB for.

Shit. I like change, but I don't want this much change. A new OC and DC could be problematic.

Skins used to have training camp in my town and my dad got hooked on the team and then passed it on to me. He got to see the successful Super Bowl-winning years while I mainly grew up being happy with a 6 win season.

Completely undeserved win but I'll take it.
Second half looked much better, just don't understand why we took 45 minutes to get going. We also need to get better against the press. It's so easy for teams to score on us through the press. So overall that performance was alarming, but all that matters is that we won.

RAMSEY always believed in him, always rated him.

It seems that if things are going his way he's much more into the game. But if he's struggling, then he just gives up. I love Mesut, but he desperately needs to fix this.
He's not at all like Jackson, Kenny Britt is more like Garon. If Garon walks then Britt wouldn't be a terrible backup, but I'd imagine Doctson would take Garon's role.

Our high line had nothing to do with Bellerin and Ramsey's lack of awareness on the first goal. Our high back line had nothing to do with Xhaka's poor decision to run straight into the Bournemouth player. And our high back line had nothing to do with Bellerin's lack of strength on the third goal. He had his man beat and then allowed himself to get pushed off the ball.

It's a long shot in my eyes at this point, but he should work to instill that winning mentality into other players at the club instead of jumping ship. Coq has it, Mesut kinda has it, but I want them all to have it. That's what has separated us from the title for this long. That mentality to never give up was shown today, which is a step in the right direction, but we need to continue to win and show that we are a mentally strong club. Then he will want to stay.
I'm happy that he cares about winning, but this scares me. This reaction portrays frustration, and the fact that he hasn't signed a contract makes me think this frustration is towards the club.
I really like Hector's mentality
It would make the most sense for him to go to Chelsea, hopefully that doesn't happen.

We were able to rescue a point from this, so it's going to be turned into a success story of fighting even when the odds are stacked against us.
However, this game was terrible. We defended poorly and made horrible mistakes. Bellerin was god awful, Xhaka was not good either. Alexis did manage to score, but even he was not making the best decisions. Giroud, Ox, and Perez I thought played quite well however. Glad we were able to rescue the point, and this does show a lot about our mentality, however if we weren't so poor to start then this wouldn't have happened. Inexcusable to concede three to a side like Bournemouth.
Alexis is trying way too hard to create something out of nothing. Work the ball.
PEREZ MY GOODNESS WHAT A FINISH
Yeah, we just don't have the quality going forward to overcome a deficit today it seems.

Jesus fuck, Bellerin has been horrible tonight.

Anyone else think Ramsey has been absolute shit any time he's stepped foot on the pitch this season? He's going to need to pick it the fuck up since Coq is now injured. We literally have two first team central midfielders right now.

There's no direction with this midfield. Xhaka is an idiot and Ramsey has been horrible. I'm not sure if there's any way back into this, but if we do end up getting back into it I think it will be through Ox, who has been the only one that has shown any sign of light.
Our midfield has no direction without Ozil, no one plays those piercing balls forward.
Wonder if Ramsey will play in the number 10 or if Iwobi will...either way this team looks strong, should win comfortably. Hoping for no injuries

Nah, we're going to sign him long term, I'm thinking 5 year $25 million (I think he'd be willing to take less than 26-27 if it means we can make a defensive signing). We'd be stupid not to in my opinion.
Also, you can't place all the blame on Kirk for losing against good teams. There were several occasions this season where he played well and we didn't win (Detroit, Cincinnati, Arizona, @Dallas, two of these teams fall into that win category). If we bolster our defense, then I think next year he'll have more success.
He's definitely worth more than that lmfao
Even if we didn't win a game in the playoffs I'd rather see us make the playoffs than not...

I'm thinking Ramsey is going to start in midfield along with Coq. If Ozil is still ill, I'd really like to see Iwobi playing in that number 10 role again. Ox on the right with Alexis on the left and Giroud up top. I would imagine that the back line will stay the same, maybe with Holding stepping in if one of Gabriel or Kos isn't fit.

Should be between 11-5 and 9-7, assuming our offense continues its production and we improve the defense. Anything less than playoffs would be unacceptable and I think we would see a massive overhaul of the coaching staff. If we win a playoff game next year I think it would be considered a successful season.

Bottom line: Kirk is the best option we have in this offseason. Whether we tag him or sign him, he's gonna be the QB next year. We'd be stupid not to resign him.
Resign Kirk and Garon, sign a high-end defensive lineman, replace several players in the secondary. We're still on the rise.
On the bright side, our defense seems to be playing now, and it is still a two possession game. Kirk, get your head out of your ass please.

I want Detroit. We can beat them. I think Seattle will be tough especially in Seattle, the Falcons have a pretty potent offense, and Green Bay had caught fire. I think we have a legitimate shot against any of these teams but Detroit is a very beatable team.

It's really interesting to see what happened. Matt Jones was drawing Marshawn Lynch comparisons coming out of college for his size and strength. Now he sits the bench as an undrafted rookie who is much more similar to Lynch is tearing it up. I feel bad for the guy, but it's survival or the fittest in the NFL, and Fat Rob is most certainly the fittest of the two. I hope we pound the rock with him for years to come.

There's no way the NFL would allow that first of all, as this would be horrible for the league's TV ratings and reputation, and second of all these two teams are division rivals playing for the NFC North championship. They aren't gonna both just roll over like that. It's win and we're in.

For the teams that play like this, I think Giroud should start. A lot of the lower-level teams aren't going to go forward a whole lot, and will have most of their players committed to defending. These are the games that are meant for Giroud. When we play a team who is willing to commit men forward against us, then that's when Alexis should start up top.

We've kept possession well. West Brom is packing it in allowing us to have a ton of possession in the final third. Looks like we'll break through soon.

This is very frustrating right now. We're right there, just can't put it in. I think West Brom is going to break down sooner or later though. Iwobi has been brilliant so far, and I think Xhaka has done a good job facilitating. I think we'll get one before halftime.
That's the thing that will make or break us. If he stays healthy I think we'll keep progressing. We can win without him, but he gives us that elite option

I think we can become very similar to what the Patriots are. Great passing game, great TE, Great O-line.
Our defense is going to need a lot of work though, and obviously Kirk is no Brady. But we have the basic outline of the Patriots' key to success. I highly doubt by the time Kirk retires he'll have the accolades that Brady does, but I do think he'll win a Super Bowl.
Not saying we're going to be the new powerhouse of the NFL like the Pats are, but I think we can end up being a similar team to what they have been in the past 5 years.
Same here. So great to finally be an above-average team.
